body:
Turns out solving the lcd display problem was pretty easy. I’m guessing it could be wrapped up into a much cleaner function but I added a bunch of if statements and it seems to do the job just fine. Quite enjoying this arduino malarky, seems to reward persistence so far :)

if (rbbuttonState == HIGH){

      steps = constrain(steps, 1, 250);

      steps += read_encoder ();

      lcd.print(“Step size: ”, 1, 0);

      if (steps < 10){

      Serial.print (00, DEC);

      }

      if (steps < 100){

      Serial.print (0, DEC);

      }

      Serial.print (steps  , DEC);

      lcd.print(“Num steps: ”, 0, 0);

      if (numPictures < 10){

      Serial.print (00, DEC);

      }

      if (numPictures < 100){

      Serial.print (0, DEC);

      }

      Serial.print (numPictures  , DEC);

    }

    else{

      numPictures = constrain(numPictures, 10, 250);

      numPictures += (read_encoder () * 10);

      lcd.print(“Step size: ”, 1, 0);

      if (steps < 10){

      Serial.print (00, DEC);

      }

      if (steps < 100){

      Serial.print (0, DEC);

      }

      Serial.print (steps  , DEC);

      lcd.print(“Num steps: ”, 0, 0);

      if (numPictures < 10){

      Serial.print (00, DEC);

      }

      if (numPictures < 100){

      Serial.print (0, DEC);

      }

      Serial.print (numPictures  , DEC);

    }
